abstract.p: Leo Hindery Jr, chief executive of Global Crossing, is expected to resign after only six months on the job; would be replaced by Thomas J Casey (S)

block.p: Leo Hindery Jr., the chief executive of Global Crossing, the Bermuda-based undersea cable operator that is building a worldwide network to transmit informtion via the Internet is expected to resign as soon as today, after only six months on the job, said a person close to the company.

Golbal Crossings' board of directors is meeting tomorrow to discuss the resignation and it is expected he will be replaced by Thomas Casey, who joined the company in September 1998 as vice chairman and was recently named to the office of the chairman. Mr. Casey is both an investment banker and worked in Washington as a regulator.
